image.altText: A man in a maroon collared shirt is pictured seating

props.synopsis: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

title.children: Boothby is a relatively wealthy electorate, but voters still worry about the cost of living

image.altText: Aliir Aliir of Port Adelaide catches a ball during an AFL game.

props.synopsis: The Swans are trying to find out if the fan who through an object over the fence at Port Adelaide's Aliir Aliir during their AFL clash is a member.

title.children: AFL fan removed by police after throwing object at Aliir

image.altText: A large black and white cruise ship with a tug on the water.

props.synopsis: A luxury cruise ship will stop in Wallaroo in 2027, carrying almost 500 passengers, renewing the town's hope of benefiting from the cruise industry.

title.children: Cruise ships to return to SA's Copper Coast after seven-year hiatus

image.altText: A young woman wearing right stares ahead with a sombre look.

props.synopsis: Lucy Savage has to drive 450 kilometres multiple times a month to access specialised care — a reality for many women living with endometriosis and chronic gynaecological conditions around the country.

title.children: The travel toll of living with endometriosis in regional Australia

image.altText: A drone shot of a crash at a highway intersection. Grey smoke is billowing from the two trucks surrounded by police cars

props.synopsis: A South Australian truck driver has been charged with causing death by dangerous driving after a fatal truck crash. Police are urging any witnesses to speak with investigators.

title.children: Truck driver arrested after fatal crash on South Australian highway

image.altText: Audience members in a red-lit room with screen at front saying Byron underground film festival.

props.synopsis: As streaming sees more and more people forgoing traditional cinemas to watch content at home, micro-cinemas showing alternative and niche films are rising in popularity across the country.

title.children: Micro-cinema subculture emerges as traditional audience streams at home

image.altText: Tait thunderbolt finds its target

props.synopsis: Shaun Tait's 161.1 kilometres per hour delivery in 2010 was the fastest ball ever bowled by an Australian and the second fastest ever bowled. Experts are concerned coaching methods may be hindering others from reaching those levels again.

title.children: Fast bowling records will stay unless coaches 'let them be aggressive'

image.altText: A tiny baby short-necked turtle held up by someone in their hand near a lake.

props.synopsis: Native freshwater turtles have declined by up to 91 per cent in parts of the River Murray, but Indigenous rangers and conservationists are fighting to bring them back.

title.children: First Nations rangers fight to save 'vacuum cleaners of the river'

image.altText: Ladybirds gathered on dry grass with others behind on the ground

props.synopsis: Dry but cool conditions in South Australia's south east are causing ladybirds to gather in huge numbers, which an ecologist says will help control a destructive plant pest.

title.children: Millions of ladybirds descend on SA town to eat pine tree pest

image.altText: A man with a blue apron stands in a room full of packaged chocolate

props.synopsis: Small businesses working over the busy Easter period are counting the cost of rising prices, global economic uncertainty and customers who are becoming more frugal.

title.children: Small businesses feel the pinch amid busy Easter period

image.altText: Sebastian Johnston is grinning

props.synopsis: After waking from a week-long induced coma, Sebastian Johnston was diagnosed with epilepsy and an acquired brain injury. Now he is calling for more understanding for young people living with the condition.

title.children: People living with epilepsy can 'slip through the cracks', advocates say

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: Matthew Draganoff is standing trial accused of the shooting murder of his tenant, Simon Middleton. Prosecutors allege there had been an "accumulation of grievances" that led to the crime.

title.children: Man allegedly murdered tenant over 'growing animosity', jury told

image.altText: Stella  hugs her daughter as they walk along the footpath outside the District Court

props.synopsis: A woman who was abused at the hands of her ex-partner – a former police detective – says she felt "silenced" after reaching out to SA Police, a court has heard. Their daughter also recounted his abuse and said she no longer considered him her father.

title.children: 'I will not be silenced': Woman confronts abusive ex-cop husband in court

image.altText: Sam Darcy looks miserable as he is framed by the coach's whiteboards during a Western Bulldogs AFL game.

props.synopsis: Scans reveal Sam Darcy's ACL is intact but he has suffered an impaction fracture in his knee, which will require surgery for the young Bulldogs star.

title.children: Bulldogs star cleared of torn ACL but still needs surgery on broken knee

image.altText: Max Verstappen and Oscar Piastri on the Jeddah podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri becomes the first Australian to lead Formula 1 drivers' championship in 15 years, passing Max Verstappen on the first corner en route to victory in Saudi Arabia.

title.children: 'He forced me off': Red Bull unhappy as penalty hands Piastri Saudi win

image.altText: Aerial shot of rough surf against rock cliffs, rescue jet ski travels through water

props.synopsis: Two men remain missing since Friday, one in NSW and the other in Victoria, as the search to recover their bodies has so far failed.

title.children: Drowning death toll rises to six in 'worst Easter long weekend'

image.altText: Two people standing at polling booths casting a vote.

props.synopsis: Political polling has been around as long as democracy itself and its influence on the election cycle is undeniable, but insiders say it’s never been more challenging to get right.

title.children: Inside the influential industry forecasting a Labor victory

image.altText: A woman crying

props.synopsis: One commander has been dismissed as a result of an investigation into the killing of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency workers, who were found in a shallow grave a month ago.

title.children: Israel says killing of Palestinian medics the result of 'poor night visibility'

image.altText: More than a thousand dolphins can be killed in annual hunts in Solomon Islands

props.synopsis: A video showing the slaughter of hundreds of dolphins in Solomon Islands has gone viral on social media, sparking heated debate in Solomon Islands and the broader Pacific about the ancient practice.

title.children: 'Dolphin hunt' continues on this island, as debate rages over ancient practice

image.altText: A woman wearing a nun's head piece standing and singing at a church service.

props.synopsis: Israel Police have been accused of turning Jerusalem's Old City into a "militarised zone" and blocking worshippers from praying over Easter, after violent scuffles broke out near one of Christianity's holiest sites.

title.children: Christians criticise Israeli police for actions in Jerusalem over Easter

image.altText: A dark blue logo with white text saying "cryptoloc".

props.synopsis: A politically-connected cybersecurity business has been liquidated months after winning a lucrative Queensland government contract.

title.children: Politically connected cybersecurity firm liquidated after winning contract

image.altText: The pope speaking into a microphone

props.synopsis: The pope, who is still recovering from a near-fatal bout of double pneumonia, drew cheers and applause from the gathered crowds.

title.children: Pope Francis appears at Easter Sunday to deliver blessing as recovery continues

image.altText: Prince Andrew, in a black suit, looks to the side

props.synopsis: The appearance was notable given Prince Andrew was absent from the royals' Christmas church service following a scandal involving an alleged Chinese spy.

title.children: Prince Andrew makes rare appearance with King Charles at Easter service

image.altText: A young man with blond hair in a suit stands next to an older man with glasses.

props.synopsis: A how-to-vote-card released by the Greens on Sunday instructs voters to pencil in a federal candidate who last week formally removed himself from the race, opening the party to criticism the move is a cash grab.

title.children: Greens urge supporters to vote for dropped candidate

props.synopsis: John King captured footage of a 100-metre-tall fire tornado only 50 metres from his back door. Fire analysts say the phenomenon is becoming more common as the climate changes.

title.children: CFA volunteers were ready for fire season, but not for a 100m fire tornado

image.altText: A burnt out car crashed into a restaurant

props.synopsis: Police say offenders drove a car into a Greek restaurant in Yarraville and set it alight before fleeing.

title.children: Police investigate suspicious fire at inner-west Melbourne restaurant

image.altText: Wiradjuri woman Tara Croker who launched startup Yaala Sparkling smiles at the camera while sitting indoors

props.synopsis: The Indigenous business sector is experiencing significant growth but challenges remain around access to capital, a lack of culturally safe support and entrenched racism.

title.children: Why a new wave of Indigenous businesses are failing to meet full potential

image.altText: Putin crosses his chest while holding a red candle sanding next to the Moscow mayor crossing his forehead.

props.synopsis: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says Russia is making a pretence of a ceasefire to advance on Ukraine's front line.

title.children: Ukraine says Russia has ramped up attacks despite ceasefire

image.altText: Minister for Women's Safety Anne Ruston

props.synopsis: The Coalition has accused Labor of "disgraceful" lies about claims a future Dutton government would scrap almost 90 existing urgent care clinics.

title.children: Coalition accuses Labor of scare tactics over claims it will cut clinics

image.altText: Lady in a cowboy hat

props.synopsis: Eromanga's annual rodeo was the first time locals had a chance to blow off steam and debrief after record-breaking floods. While they're ready to build back stronger, it could be months until they know the extent of their losses.

title.children: Outback rodeo brings community together after flood disaster

image.altText: three people standing together, holding large letters that spell 'hope'

props.synopsis: It's been 10 years since three people died in flash flooding that devastated Dungog. The town's artistic flair and commitment to preparedness have been crucial to its recovery and the remembering of those lost.

title.children: Ten years on, storm that shocked Dungog still front of mind for locals

image.altText: A white police car turns in front of a well-lit brown building at night on a deserted city street.

props.synopsis: The state opposition says it's obtained documents showing Melbourne's first COVID curfew was announced without proper health advice.

title.children: FOI reveals idea for a Melb COVID curfew did not come from health experts

image.altText: Cartoon characters Bart, Marge, Homer, Lisa and baby Maggie

props.synopsis: More than 35 years on from its debut, The Simpsons has been extended, but US Census data shows the nature of a typical family life has vastly changed since the beloved show has been on-air.

title.children: Families once mirrored The Simpsons. Now they don't, but the show is still going
